means: <苏格兰>知道( ken的现在分词 )

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 19th cent.: from Old Norse, from kenna know, 'perceive'; related to ken

means.word_mean: 1. conventional metaphoric name for something, used especially in Old English and Old Norse poetry

auth_sentence.content: In mitigation for McCooty, Thomas Kenning said he had gone into the store and picked up beer.
